content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the kaunas district court the specific details about the parties involved are not provided the defendant in the case had to pay stamp duty and court fees the court made a final decision regarding the division of matrimonial property the applicant and the defendant were both awarded a 50 share of various properties including buildings land plots and a car the defendant was also ordered to pay compensation for a highervalue property the text mentions several articles from the civil code that are relevant to the case the applicant is seeking a divorce from the defendant and requesting the division of property acquired during the marriage the applicant presented evidence of the defendants misconduct during the hearing the marriage was registered in the civil registry office and the property will be divided equally the applicant will no longer drive the car and requests compensation the costs of the proceedings will be exempted for the applicant and recovered from the defendant the court has dissolved the marriage and both parties will retain their married names in terms of property division both parties will receive a 50 share of various buildings land plots and a car the defendant is also responsible for paying stamp duty and procedural document service costs
